topic: JavaScript Design Patterns and Best Practices
detailedSummary: Design patterns are reusable solutions to common programming problems. The Module pattern encapsulates code and creates private scope, preventing global namespace pollution. The Singleton pattern ensures only one instance exists. Factory functions create objects without using constructors. Observer pattern allows objects to notify multiple observers of state changes. MVC (Model-View-Controller) separates data, presentation, and logic. Best practices include: avoiding global variables, using meaningful names, writing DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) code, keeping functions small and focused, handling errors properly, and writing readable code. Code organization involves modular structure, consistent formatting, and clear comments. Performance best practices include: minimizing DOM manipulation, debouncing/throttling events, lazy loading, and optimizing loops. Security practices include: validating input, sanitizing data, avoiding eval(), and using HTTPS. Understanding design patterns and best practices leads to maintainable, scalable, and professional code.
whyItMatters: Design patterns and best practices are essential for writing maintainable, scalable code that other developers can understand and work with - they're fundamental to professional software development.

assignments.title: Implement Design Patterns
assignments.description: Apply JavaScript design patterns and best practices to refactor and improve code quality.
tasks: Refactor code to use the Module pattern to encapsulate functionality
Implement the Observer pattern for event-driven architecture
Apply DRY principles to eliminate code duplication
Refactor functions to be smaller, focused, and more readable
Write a report analyzing code improvements and explaining pattern choices

quizzes.question: What is the main purpose of the Module pattern?
options: To encapsulate code and create private scope
quizzes.explanation: The Module pattern encapsulates code, creates private scope, and prevents global namespace pollution by keeping variables and functions private.

quizzes.question: DRY stands for 'Don't Repeat Yourself' and means avoiding code duplication.
quizzes.explanation: True. DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) is a principle that encourages code reuse and avoiding duplication to improve maintainability.

quizzes.question: What does the Observer pattern do?
options: Allows objects to notify multiple observers of state changes
quizzes.explanation: The Observer pattern allows objects (subjects) to notify multiple observers (listeners) when state changes, enabling event-driven architecture.
